By default, git config push.default is set to simple, meaning it will never be happy if the remote branch doesn't match the local branch's name, even if the remote is set as the upstream. Setting git config push.default upstream will suppress those errors. å¼•ç”¨äº: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/24864700/fatal-the-upstream-branch-of-your-current-branch-does-not-match-the-name-of-you#comment-64377707
